com.nickeson.games.cardgames

Class Shoe

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.nickeson.games.cardgames.Shoe

  • public class Shoe
extends java.lang.Object
    Title: Shoe.java

    Project: cardgames

    Description: A Shoe of Cards for use in card games

    Copyright: Copyright (c) 2016

    Company: Silicon Mountain Technologies

    Since:
    May 17, 2016

    updates:

    Version:
    2.0
    Author:
    nickeson

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Shoe()
      default constructor builds a 6-Deck Shoe
      Shoe(int numDecks)
      convenience constructor to build a Shoe with a specific number of Decks
      Shoe(int numDecks, java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> options)
      convenience constructor to build a Shoe with a specific number of Decks, which are built using options from a Map we pass in

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addDiscards()
      move all Cards from discard pile back to the Shoe
      int cardCount()
      returns the number of Cards in the Shoe
      void discard(int shoeLoc)
      move the Card at 'shoeLoc' to the discards pile
      Card getCard()
      Get the next Card in the Deck (starting with top Card [0]), add card to inUse pile and remove from Deck
      Card getCard(int shoeLoc)
      return the Card from Shoe at 'shoeLoc', remove Card from Shoe and add to inUse pile
      Card getRandom()
      return a Card from a random location in the Deck, remove from the Deck and add to inUse pile
      java.util.List<Card> getShoe()
      (Does not remove cards from the Shoe (or move to inUse or discards) returns the Shoe as a List of Cards
      void reInitialize()
      add Card(s) from inUse and discards piles back to Shoe, shuffle the Shoe
      void shuffle()
      add Card(s) from discards pile back to Shoe, shuffle the Shoe
      int size()
      returns the number of Decks in the Shoe
      java.lang.String toString()
      Override toString() method to print the Shoe's String value instead of hashcode

    • Constructor Detail

      • Shoe

        public Shoe()
        default constructor builds a 6-Deck Shoe

        convenience constructor to build a Shoe with a specific number of Decks
        Parameters:
        numDecks - the number of Decks in the Shoe

      • Shoe

        public Shoe(int numDecks,
            java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> options)
        convenience constructor to build a Shoe with a specific number of Decks, which are built using options from a Map we pass in
        Parameters:
        numDecks - the number of Decks in the Shoe
        options - the Map of options used to build the Decks in the Shoe

    • Method Detail

      • getCard

        public Card getCard()
        Get the next Card in the Deck (starting with top Card [0]), add card to inUse pile and remove from Deck
        Returns:
        the next Card from the Deck

      • getCard

        public Card getCard(int shoeLoc)
        return the Card from Shoe at 'shoeLoc', remove Card from Shoe and add to inUse pile
        Parameters:
        shoeLoc - the location in the Shoe from which to remove the Card
        Returns:
        the Card from the Shoe at 'shoeLoc'

      • getShoe

        public java.util.List<Card> getShoe()
        (Does not remove cards from the Shoe (or move to inUse or discards) returns the Shoe as a List of Cards
        Returns:
        the Shoe as a List of Cards

      • getRandom

        public Card getRandom()
        return a Card from a random location in the Deck, remove from the Deck and add to inUse pile
        Returns:
        a randomly drawn Card from the Deck

      • discard

        public void discard(int shoeLoc)
        move the Card at 'shoeLoc' to the discards pile
        Parameters:
        shoeLoc - the Card at 'shoeLoc' to move to the discards pile

      • addDiscards

        public void addDiscards()
        move all Cards from discard pile back to the Shoe

      • shuffle

        add Card(s) from discards pile back to Shoe, shuffle the Shoe
